trans-unit.target: You already have an active friend request at Kompisbyrån.

Meet a new Fika friend at a café for about 1 hour, “fika” and practice Swedish. You know in advanced that you have some similar interests that you can start the conversation with. We call this a “Friend fika”.
Share your music interest with new friends from various cultures.

We believe that music unites. That’s why we now start Musikkompis together with the mobile company 3. With Musikkompis, we give people a chance to meet through music. Play instruments together, go to concerts or talk music over a cup of coffee.
Get to know or show the neighborhood
Are you newly arrived in the municipality, or have you lived in the area for a very long time and want to show your neighborhood during a walk? Sign up as a Start friend.
To meet new friends, you need to enter your e-mail and a password of your choice.
Share your music interest with new friends from various cultures.

We believe that music unites. That’s why we now start Musikkompis together with the mobile company 3 . With Musikkompis, we give people a chance to meet through music. Play instruments together, go to concerts or talk music over a cup of coffee. It doesn't matter if you are a professional or an amateur - we want to make it easier for all people who likes music, to meet other music enthusiasts with different background, experiences and cultures.
Musikkompis is an initiative by 3 and Kompisbyrån

Let’s share your music experiences with new friends. Together, we can create many moments of togetherness regardless of where we come from. In the end, this contributes to greater tolerance and understanding in the society. This is why we start the project Musikkompis - a voluntary collaboration between 3 and Kompisbyrån, we wish to strengthen the integration and the feeling of togetherness in the society through music. We want to give more people the opportunity to share their music interests together with new friends: artists, underground bands, DJs, classical musicians and music fans. Sign up as a Musikkompis.
Here you can see some music friends and their music meetings

Naim Kassis, a 45-year-old pianist from Aleppo in Syria, came to Sweden a year ago and ended up in an asylum accommodation in northern Sweden, where he has given numerous concerts. On a cold winter day, he met Sabina Ddumba, and together they played a version of Sabina's hit single "Not too young", which attracted the whole accommodation to take part in the meeting.

Filipe Minhava is a 19-year-old guitarist from Portugal who has lived in Sweden for three months at a friends place in Högdalen. Filipe and Little Jinder met in Stockholm and got to know each other during a day where they visited a flea market, checked on LPs and ate at a restaurant, before they rounded off with the classic hit ”La Bamba” at a karaoke bar.

Bahar Hasko, a Kurdish English teacher, was born in Kamishlo in Syria. Today, she lives and studies in Sweden. Bahar and Eva Dahlgren met one day and talked about music as a way to communicate and learn languages. At the end of the day, Bahar surprised Eva with a children's orchestra who played Eva's classic "Vem tänder stjärnorna".
If you already have signed up, please sign in here:
If you visit us for the first time, you have to %link_start%sign up here%link_end%.
I am a new Swede and want to speak better Swedish
I am an established Swede and have Swedish as mother tongue or equivalent
(Select minimum of 2 and maximum of 5 interests)
What do you want to do with your Musikkompis?
Tell us about yourself and who you would describe yourself as a person:

I.e. how you would describe yourself as a person, things that you like to do, education, occupation, and for how long you've been in Sweden. Musikkompis, please write if you play an instrument and which genre of music you like.
You will be connected with a person who has similar interests as you. You meet at café and speak Swedish in 1 hour.

You will be connected with a person who also likes music. You meet in a public place to share your music interest. For example, you talk about music at a café, you visit a concert or play instruments together.

You will be connected with a person who you meet and go for a walk with to discover the area where you both live. Right now, you can sign up if you live in Lidingö, Nynäshamn, Solna, Tyresö, Vaxholm or Österåker.
Write about the things that you like to do:
In which field are you looking for a job?
How long have you lived in Sweden?
Tell us about your interest in music:
Are you a professional musician or an amateur?
What genres of music do you like?

Please, answer some questions about yourself. The clearer you describe who you are as a person, the greater is the chance that we find a good match for you. Please have in mind that if you have special demands, it can be more difficult for us to find a good match. Try not to have high expectations but take it as it comes!
As a Fika friend or Music friend, you meet in 1 of 9 cities where we operate: Göteborg, Jönköping, Linköping, Malmö, Stockholm, Umeå, Uppsala, Västerås or Örebro.
As a Start friend, you meet in 1 of 5 municipalities in Stockholm county: Lidingö, Nynäshamn, Solna, Tyresö, Vaxholm or Österåker.

We provide the first contact to a person who you meet 1 time. On this page, you can make a new request to meet a new Fika, Music or Start friend.
You can also see Previous meetings and if you already have an Active request.
You have an active request. Kompisbyrån will contact you when we have found a good match (or if you need to complete your application).
You have an active request. Kompisbyrån will contact you when we have found a good match (or if you need to complete your application).
I want to meet a new person
In which municipality do you want to meet your Start friend?
Do you want to bring an extra person to the meeting?
Do you have wishes about who you want to meet?
Do you have wishes about who you want to meet?
Kompisbyrån mediates the first contact between new Swedes and established Swedes.

• Our idea is to give you the possibility to meet several new persons with another background than yours, in order for you to broaden your social network.
  • Kompisbyrån connects two new fika friends, mainly based on similar interests; new music friends based on similar music interests and new start friends based on the municipality they both live in.
  • As a Fika friend or Music friend, you must be able to meet your new Fika or Music friend in 1 of 9 cities: Göteborg, Jönköping, Linköping, Malmö, Stockholm, Umeå, Uppsala, Västerås or Örebro. We hope that we can connect new people in more cities in the future.
  • As a Start friend, you must be able to meet in 1 of 6 municipalities: Lidingö, Nynäshamn, Solna, Tyresö, Vaxholm or Österåker.
  • Kompisbyrån is only responsible for linking together people who have lived in Sweden for a short time with people who have lived in Sweden for a long time.
  • The starting point is that you meet the same person 1 time. If you think it is fun, you can meet again by your own. If you want to meet a new person, you sign in and make a new request.
  • Everyone over 18 years (of age) can participate.
  • The registration is for free. Any costs for refreshments/"fika" or other expenses related to the meeting must be paid by each person.
  • Kompisbyrån recommends that you meet for about 1 hour at a public place in the central part of that city that you have chosen.
  • When you have registered your application, you warrant that your information is correct and agree that the information: may be treated according to PUL and is saved in Kompisbyrån's register so that we can find new friends for you, that your information, e-mail and telephone number are sent to your new friend, and that we will invite you to Kompisbyrån's activities or offerings. If you want to adjust your submitted information that is registered, please log in with your e-mail and password and update your profile. Controller of personal data is Kompisbyrån’s Board.
  • Our ambition is to find a new friend for you within 30 days. That means that you may have to wait.
  • We confirm that we have received your application, by sending an e-mail to you.
  • Remember to respect each other. A cancellation will affect the other person who has been looking forward to a meeting. Think twice before you sign up, to ensure that you really want to join us!
  • It is the main responsibility of the established Swede that you get in contact with each other within 7 days. We recommend that you exchange telephone numbers to easier get in contact with each other.
  • You need to treat each other in a respectful manner. Remember to be clear in you communication with each other, as language differences can create misunderstandings.
  • You share Kompispbyrån's belief in the equality of all human beings, regardless of sex, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other belief, disability, sexual orientation or age.
  • If you want to delete your account, please send an e-mail to kontakt@kompisbyran.se.
  • Kompisbyrån cannot guarantee that we will find a good match for you, but we will always do our best.
  • We wish to constantly improve our work. Therefore, we will contact you after your meeting to follow up.
Thank you for accepting Kompisbyrån's terms!

Thank you for making a Fika friend request through Kompisbyrån!

This is how it works:

1. Match. We will send you an email (often within 1-30 days) when we have found new Fika friend for you who has similar interests as you. (If you need to complete your application, we will let you know)

2. Decide a date. You send an email to the person within 7 days, and decide date, time and place. Write in Swedish or English (some find Google Translate as a good tool). It is the responsibility of both that you establish contact. Remember to respect each other, not responding an email will affect the other person who has been looking forward to a meeting. Contact us if you don’t get answer.

3. Meeting. You meet at a café or other public place for about 1 hour. Try not to have high expectations but take it as it comes. Be in time! The boring meetings is when someone doesn’t show up, so please exchange telephone numbers and send a text message reminder the day before your meeting, that the other person confirm.

If you have any questions, please send us an e-mail :)

Best regards,
Kompisbyrån

Thank you for making a Music friend request through Kompisbyrån!

This is how it works:

1. Match. We will send you an email (often within 1-30 days) when we have found a new Music friend who has similar interests as you. (If you need to complete your application, we will let you know)

2. Decide a date. You send an email to the person within 7 days, and decide date, time and place. Write in Swedish or English (some find Google Translate as a good tool). It is the responsibility of both that you establish contact. Remember to respect each other, not responding an email will affect the other person who has been looking forward to a meeting. Contact us if you don’t get answer.

3. Meeting. You meet at a café or other public place for about 1 hour. Try not to have high expectations but take it as it comes. Be in time! The boring meetings is when someone doesn’t show up, so please exchange telephone numbers and send a text message reminder the day before your meeting, that the other person confirm.

If you have any questions, please send us an email :)

Best regards,
Kompisbyrån
Thank you for your Start friend application!

Dear %firstName%!

Thank you for your registration as Start friend (Startkompis)! With this email, we are confirming that we have received your application.

Here is a short reminder of how it works:

1. Match. We will send you an email (usually within 1-30 days) when we have found a person who matches your profile. You get the person's contact information and we propose a date, time and place of your meeting. (If you need to complete your application, we will let you know.)

2. First contact. You contact the person within 7 days and confirm your meeting. Please write in English and Swedish. It’s the primarily responsibility of the person who is established in Sweden, that you get in touch with each other. If the time we have proposed does not suit you, you must ensure that you find a new time that suits both.
Remember to respect each other, not responding affect the other person who has been looking forward to your meeting. Contact us if you need help to get in touch!

3. Meeting. You meet and go for a walk in the neighborhood for about 1 hour. Try not to have high expectations but take it as it comes. We recommend that you send an SMS reminder the day before your meeting, that the other person confirm. Be in time!

If you have any questions, please contact us!

Best wishes
The Startkompis-team at Kompisbyrån

Kompisbyrån is a non-profit organization since 2014. We connect new fika friends with different backgrounds and experiences but with similar interests. A new and an established Swede meet to practise Swedish over a “fika”. We want to make integration easy and accessible. Today, Kompisbyrån is active in 9 cities, has a dozen active ambassadours, and nearly 10 000 contacts from 126 countries have been mediated.
Read our terms very carefully before you sign up.

Support us, and you will give the chance for more people to meet new fika friends. Your gift is very valuable to us, no matter how much or little you choose to donate. Kompisbyrån's Swish number is: 1236 809 602 or BG account 386-3982.

Meet a person with similar interests that you have, at a café for about 1 hour, “fika” and practice Swedish. One person is new in Sweden, and one person has lived in Sweden for a long time*. This is what we call a “Friend fika” (Kompisfika).

You must be able to meet your Fika friend in: Göteborg, Jönköping, Linköping, Malmö, Stockholm, Umeå, Uppsala, Västerås or Örebro.

How to meet a new Fika friend:

1. Registration. Press the “Sign up”-button and fill out the application. The registration is for free. You will receive a confirmation email when we have received your application.

2. Match. We will send you an email with the contact details to your Fika friend.

3. Confirm the meeting. You contact your Fika friend within 7 days to confirm date, time and place of the meeting.

4. Meeting. You meet at a café for about 1 hour and practice Swedish. If you want, please take a picture from your meeting and send to us!

5. What happens after the meeting? We will contact you after the meeting to get to know more about your experience. If both of you thought it was fun, you are welcome to continue to see each other on your own. You can also sign in and make a new application to meet a new person, or simply be super happy to have been someone's Fika friend!

*We let each person decide how they want to define themselves, as new or established. Being new in Sweden, you want to speak better Swedish, it does not matter how long or short period of time you have lived in Sweden. As established in Sweden, you have Swedish as a mother tongue or equivalent, and can tech Swedish in order to help someone to improve their Swedish pronunciation, vocabulary and so on.
We mediate the first contact to a new fika friend that you meet 1 time (if you two don’t decide otherwise). If you want to meet a new person, you can log in and make a new request.

Give your support!

Would you as an individual, company, municipality or other organization, cooperate with Kompisbyrån? Today, thousands of fika friends from over 126 countries have come to know each other over a "fika". Many meetings have led to job opportunities. Some to own apartments. And above all, they have led to friendships that unites different countries, cultures, gender, ages, languages and experiences.

We are only funded through partnerships. It is through them that we can help all the thousands of people who want to create a social context in society. Join us on our journey to a more open society in which everyone can feel included and welcome.

Your gift is very valuable to us! Every penny we receive goes into creating more opportunities for new and established Swedes to meet.

Please send a "Swish" of 300 SEK to 1236 809 602 or deposit money at BG Account 386-3982.

We would like to give you a personal gift certificate as a thank you. Please, send an email to kontakt@kompisbyran.se.

We are more than happy to speak with you about how you can support Kompisbyrån in several ways. Please don’t hesitate to contact: emma@kompisbyran.se or kontakt@kompisbyran.se.

Many thanks to you all who are involved and really make a difference!

Thanks to...

Delicato, our main partner for ”Fikakompis”. Together we want to increase the integration in the Swedish society by connecting new friends over a ”fika”.

Svenska Postkodstiftelsen

Sigtunastiftelsen which awarded Kompisbyrån with "Abrahams barns pris"

Lernia

A special thanks to...

Alexandra Arvidson, Carl Lindström, Frida Benno-Hjerpe, Jessie Moberg, Johanna Nordin, Mikael Öhrén, Noa Bachner, Sameer Marmary, Sebastian Stenlund, Stella Hernström, and Stina Wäppling

Kompisbyrån is a non-profit organization who connects new and established Swedes based on similar interests. Kompisbyrån was founded in 2014 by Emma Hammar and Cecilia Holmgren with a vision to increase the spirit of community in the society, by simplifying the conditions for more meetings in the everyday life between people of different backgrounds, experiences and cultures. The aim is to speak Swedish during a one-hour “fika”. That is what we call a “friend fika” (“kompisfika”).

If we facilitate enough amount of meetings, new Swedes get better knowledge of Swedish, broaden their social networks and improve their job opportunities. More everyday meetings also lead to a greater understanding of each other as human beings, and enrich our lives. To name a fraction.

Kompisbyrån operates in 9 cities in Sweden: Göteborg, Jönköping, Linköping, Malmö, Stockholm, Umeå, Uppsala, Västerås and Örebro; and 6 municipalities: Lidingö, Nynäshamn, Solna, Tyresö, Vaxholm and Österåker.

"Many Swedes associate a “fika” with something relaxed and fun, and is often perceived as central in the Swedish culture. That’s why we think it fits so well to meet and practice Swedish over just a fika.” - Emma Hammar and Cecilia Holmgren, Founders of Kompisbyrån

Discover your neighborhood with a new friend!

Go for an 1 hour walk together with an established local who has lived in your neighborhood for a long time. You must live in one of these municipalities: Lidingö, Nynäshamn, Solna, Tyresö, Vaxholm or Österåker.

How to sign up for a Start friend:

1. Registration. Press the “Sign up”-button and fill out the application. The registration is for free. You will receive a confirmation email when we have received your application. If you are a newcomer, you can also sign up through your municipality.

2. Match. We will send you an email with the contact details to your Start friend, or we will call you.

3. Confirm the meeting. You contact your Start friend within 7 days to confirm date, time and place of the meeting.

4. Meeting. You meet and go for a walk in the neighborhood for about 1 hour. If you want, please take a picture from your meeting and send to us!

5. What happens after the meeting? We will contact you after the meeting to get to know more about your experience. If both of you thought it was fun, you are welcome to continue to see each other on your own. You can also sign in and make a new application to meet a new person, or simply be super happy to have been someone's Start friend!
To become start friends you need to live in one of these municipalities: Nynäshamn, Vaxholm, Österåker, Lidingö, Solna or Tyresö.
Your friend request has been saved. We will contact you when we find a match.
